Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libvirt-python
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libvirt-python-debuginfo
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: libvirt-python
Vulnerability.Description: The libvirt-python packages contain a module that permits applications written in the Python programming language to use the interface supplied by the libvirt library to use the virtualization capabilities of Red Hat Enterprise Linux. These packages were previously shipped within the libvirt packages. The libvirt-python packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.8.2, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1175276, BZ#1167336, BZ#1136354, BZ#1155484, BZ#1155016, BZ#1116978, BZ#1147022, BZ#1144284, BZ#1160792, BZ#1161039, BZ#1138570, BZ#1147639) Users of libvirt-python are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
